snippet: New grievances from Senate Republicans, including some running for re-election, threaten a bright spot that was supposed to end the budget wars, at least for now.
abstract: Bipartisan budget deal that sailed through House on overwhelming, bipartisan vote is running into difficulty getting past Senate Republicans; some are furious, some conservative and some running for office vow to vote against measure, which would roll back broad spending cuts.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: New grievances from Senate Republicans, including some running for re-election, threaten a bright spot that was supposed to end the budget wars, at least for now.

headline.main: Bipartisan Budget Deal Forged in House Faces Opposition in Senate
headline.print_headline: Bipartisan Budget Deal Forged in House Faces Opposition in Senate
